newsitem.title: USA: Senate Republicans to introduce budget amendment.
newsitem.headline: Senate Republicans to introduce budget amendment.

text.p: Senate Republican leaders said Tuesday they will introduce a balanced budget amendment to the U.S. Constitution with an eye toward holding a vote on the plan in February.
The amendment would have no impact on the annual budget deficit until it passes the House by a two thirds vote and is ratified by 38 of the 50 states.
The process is expected to take up to five years, putting its enactment after the 2002 date Congress and the White House have set for balancing the budget.
It is expected to pass the Senate but faces an uphill battle in the House due to Republican election losses.
